snippet: From California's coastal forests to its towns and high country, humans are running into mountain lions so often that the state has begun cougar "boot camps" to train game wardens in the ways of one of nature's finest killing machines.   During th...
lead_paragraph: From California's coastal forests to its towns and high country, humans are running into mountain lions so often that the state has begun cougar "boot camps" to train game wardens in the ways of one of nature's finest killing machines. During the last year, California's big cats have killed two people, wounded several and menaced still others, who managed to escape unharmed. On April 11, a game warden near Santa Barbara shot to death a mountain lion that had attacked a dog.

headline.main: Cougar Attacks On the Increase In California
